text: Hello guys, Would i update some contact and deal with event using event api from HubSpot ? and how it works?

I also have a custom events-related question. Does anybody know whether the HubSpot default event properties are meant to be filled in by outside events? Or should they mostly remain in use only for events on a HubSpot website. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/custom-events>

If you want to add an event to a given contact, yeah, you can declare the object in the API call; part of the standard API documentation. But you only need to use the API if you're firing an event from outside of your CMS-hosted website. You could just use custom event tool to set an event on a CMS site, and then the event will be fired onto the contact with HS tracking code identification

hi! PM of custom events here--the default properties are automatically populated when the event is generated via the HubSpot tracking script--aka for events created via the visualizer or from the custom javascript functionality. if sending external data via api, and you have data that is the equivalent of these default properties you are welcome to utilize them, they just won't populate by default
Amazing. Thanks Maggie. That's exactly what I needed. And nice to meet you!
Nice to meet you!! Let me know if you have any other questions or feedback :)
Thanks man, that helps me a lot.
Will definitely do. Always enjoy meeting fellow PMs, especially of cool HubSpot features
